title: Deploy the suite on Azure
content:
This section provides information required to install and configure the suite on Azure, including the preparation, installation, and setup tasks.

In addition, you can optionally install and enable the Native Service Asset & Configuration Management (SACM) solution after the suite deployment (see the Enable Native SACM section). Native SACM is one single solution for the entire Service Asset & Configuration Management process with instant access to the data and embedded graphical widgets for CI topology representation.

Before you begin, ensure that you have the deployment architecture planned.

The following table provides a list of tasks that you must complete in the given order. A user can have multiple roles.

Prepare

Complete these preparation tasks before installing the suite.

Sr No. Task Where to perform Role How to perform
1 Activate a Docker Hub account to download the product images from Docker Hub. Any client that has Internet connectivity Any Activate Docker Hub account
2

Prepare the required Azure resources and create an AKS cluster to install and manage the suite.

 Azure Cloud Shell Cloud administrator, IT / Network administrator, and IT / Kubernetes Cluster administrator Build AKS cluster
3

Create and configure a bastion node to communicate with the AKS cluster for the suite installation and troubleshooting tasks.

 Azure portal and bastion node IT / Server administrator Configure bastion
4 Download ESM chart package Bastion node  Suite administrator Download ESM Chart package
5
 

If you wish to use a static persistent volume, subscribe NetApp Files to store data on Azure.

 Azure portal and bastion node Storage administrator Subscribe to NetApp Files

If you wish to use a static persistent volume, subscribe premium Azure Files and Azure Disks to store on Azure. 

 Bastion node Storage administrator Subscribe premium Azure Files and Azure Disks
6 Prepare a virtual machine and install PostgreSQL on it as the database engine. This PostgreSQL instance will be used as the external databases for the suite in a production environment. Azure portal and PostgreSQL server IT / Server administrator and Database administrator Create external databases
7

Required only for the CMP FinOps capability.

Prepare an internal Vertica datastore component to store CMP FinOps data.

 PostgreSQL server Database administrator (Optional) Install and configure Vertica database
8

Download the suite images from the image registry and import them to your own registry beforehand.

 Bastion node  Suite administrator Transfer images beforehand

Install OPTIC Management Toolkit (OMT)

If you wish to use the OMT AppHub for any stage in your deployment, you need to first install OMT. 

Skip this step if you don't require OMT for your deployment, and you need to enable the OMT Tools capability on your bastion node. See Enable the Tools capability on a new bastion node.

The link in the table takes you to the OMT documentation. In the OMT documentation, follow the steps required for external (Azure) Kubernetes only. After completing the OMT installation, return to this page to install the SMA suite.

Task Where to perform Role How to perform
Install OPTIC Management Toolkit (OMT). Bastion Suite administrator Install OMT on an external K8s

Note that the OMT documentation contains information related to other deployments and is not SMA-specific. Pay attention to the following while using the document:

  1. Refer to the specifications listed in Support matrix for Azure deployment and Plan the deployment for both the suite and OMT.
  2. For information relating to Kubernetes, perform only the steps for Azure.
  3. When preparing an external database, skip the option for Oracle and ipv6 as they are currently not supported by SMA.
  4. When completing the OMT post-upgrade tasks, skip the task for configuring load balancers. You will perform this task using SMA-specific steps provided when installing SMA.

Install the suite

Complete these tasks to install the suite.

Sr No. Task Where to perform Role How to perform
1 Create a new deployment for ESM. Bastion node  Suite administrator Create a new deployment for ESM
2 Prepare persistent volumes for ESM. Bastion node  Suite administrator Prepare persistent volumes for ESM
3 Perform pre-installation checks Bastion node  Suite administrator Perform pre-installation checks
4

Install the suite using CLI.

To install using CLI, you'll have to first Create my-values.yaml.

 Bastion node Suite administrator

Install ESM using CLI

Install the suite using OMT AppHub.

To install using OMT AppHub, you'll first have to Configure a new load balancer for OMT. 

 AppHub Installation portal Suite administrator Install ESM using AppHub
5 Configure a load balancer for suite. Azure web console Suite administrator
  • If you haven't configured a load balancer, see Configure a new load balancer 
  • If you already configured a load balancer for OMT, see Configure the Suite to use the same load balancer as OMT
6 Verify the installation. Bastion node Suite administrator Verify ESM installation

Set up tenants

After installing the suite, perform the following initial setup tasks to use the suite.

Sr No. Task Where to perform Role How to perform
1

Tasks for suite administrators to perform in Suite Administration.

 Suite Administration Suite administrator Tenant setup tasks for suite administrators
2

Tasks for tenant administrators to perform in Service Management.

 Service Management Tenant administrators Tenant setup tasks for tenant administrators

Install add-on capabilities

Skip this section if you don't want to install add-on capabilities or if you've installed them during the suite installation.

Install add-on capabilities on top of an existing suite if you didn't select them from the installation portal when deploying the suite. 

Sr No. Task Where to perform Role How to perform
1

Install the SMPS, DND, CMP FinOps, and SAM capabilities on top of an existing suite.

 OMT management portal Suite administrator Install add-on capabilities

Enable capabilities

Configure and enable capabilities after their installation.

Sr No. Task Where to perform Role How to perform
1

Enable the SAM capability.

 Suite Administration Suite administrator and tenant administrator Enable SAM
2

Enable the Operations Orchestration Containerized capability.

 Suite Administration and Service Management Suite administrator and tenant administrator Enable OO Containerized in Suite Administration
3

Enable the DND capability.

 Suite Administration and Service Management Suite administrator and tenant administrator Enable DND
4

Enable the CMP FinOps capability.

 Suite Administration and Service Management Suite administrator and tenant administrator Enable CMP FinOps

Enable Native SACM

Skip this section if you don't want to use the Native SACM solution.

Configure and enable Native SACM after the suite deployment.

Task Where to perform Role How to perform

Enable Native SACM by using the UCMDB Gateway.

 Suite Administration Suite administrator Enable Native SACM
